C

Command - Interface in concurrency.command
A Command represents a command.
commit(int) - Method in class concurrency.control.ConcurrencyController
Commits the specified Transaction.
commit(int) - Method in class concurrency.control.Strict2PLConcurrencyController
Commits the specified Transaction.
CommitCommand - Class in concurrency.command
A CommitCommand represents a command for committing a Transaction.
CommitCommand() - Constructor for class concurrency.command.CommitCommand
Constructs a CommitCommand.
concurrency - package concurrency
Provides classes for concurrency control.
concurrency.command - package concurrency.command
Provides classes that implement commands.
concurrency.control - package concurrency.control
Provides classes that implement concurrency control protocols.
concurrency.test - package concurrency.test
Provides classes for testing concurrency control implementation.
ConcurrencyController<V> - Class in concurrency.control
A ConcurrencyController controls concurrent execution of Transactions in a manner that achieves conflict-serializability.
ConcurrencyController(StorageManager<V>) - Constructor for class concurrency.control.ConcurrencyController
Constructs a ConcurrencyController.
ConcurrencyController.AbortException - Exception in concurrency.control
An AbortException is thrown if a Transaction needs to be aborted.
ConcurrencyController.InvalidTransactionIDException - Exception in concurrency.control
An InvalidTransactionIDException is thrown if an invalid Transaction ID is given to a ConcurrencyController.
ConcurrencyControlTest - Class in concurrency.test
The ConcurrencyControlTest class tests ConcurrencyControllers.
ConcurrencyControlTest(String, Class<?>, PrintStream) - Constructor for class concurrency.test.ConcurrencyControlTest
Tests the specified ConcurrencyController using a schedule defined in the specified file.
ConcurrencyControlTest.UnsupportedCommandException - Exception in concurrency.test
An UnsupportedCommandException is thrown if a ConcurrencyControlTest is given an unknown command.
